availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henri F. Middleton (Shelby County, Kentucky, newspaper editor)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, newspaper editor. Virginia native. Married to Mary F. Middleton. Father of Mary A. R. Middleton and John N. H. Middleton. Newspaper editor in Shelby County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1850. Newspaper editor in Shelby County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 296B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 22 of 50 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 248.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 42.
Find A Grave, "H. F. Middleton (1813-1878)," Memorial #144499947, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/144499947/henri-fulton-middleton (accessed September 5, 2020).
